1.name: The Fool
1.keywords: New beginnings; Potential; Innocence; Freedom; Naivety
description: The Fool is the zeroth card in the Tarot deck, representing unlimited energy. The Major Arcana is the journey that this fool takes.

Stepping into the card, a young man is standing at the edge of a cliff, unaware of the danger around him. He doesn’t worry about the rough path or the deep drop ahead. Instead, he looks up at the wide blue sky and the eternal universe. He is starting a new journey for himself. On his shoulder, he carries a small bag containing all his life experiences. In his hand, he holds a white flower as a symbol of innocence and purity. At his feet, a loyal white dog barks, warning him of the dangers ahead. The dog wants to protect its owner, but the young man doesn’t seem to notice. He is deep diving in thoughts about his new adventure.
meaning: The Fool carries fresh energy. It is the card of new beginnings, opportunities, and unlimited potential. You may not know what comes next, but you still believe and hope. Just like him, follow your heart, even if it feels crazy. Step out of your comfort zone and see where the Universe leads you. The Fool supports your desire to explore new and exciting ideas. Put aside your worries and move forward with courage. Believe in yourself. You will grow and learn through each adventure.

Just do it, don't just think about it. Even if you don't have enough luggage or aren't prepared for what will happen next. You don’t need to wait for the perfect moment or a full plan, just begin with what you have.. You don’t need anyone to give you a chance - create your own!

Use your creativity and sense of wonder. Live like a child, carefree, worry-free and open to life. Challenge yourself and learn from your mistakes. Listen to the guidance of the Universe and accept it.
reMeaning: You may have a good idea but are delaying taking action. You hesitate, even though you know it’s something positive. Fear of failure, lack of confidence, and the belief that it’s not the right time are holding you back. Ask yourself: “Will I take this chance to succeed, or will I wait for something better that may never come?” Try to balance your fears with trust that the Universe will support you, move forward with courage, even if the road is unclear. Face your fears to overcome this procrastination.

On the other hand, a reversed Fool can mean that you are being too risky or acting recklessly. You want to explore and have new experiences, but be aware that your actions might bring danger to yourself and others. Take a broader view, be confident in your own madness, and don't let it affect others. Take responsibility for what you do.
Sometimes, this card shows that you are too naive or easily fooled. Be careful and thoughtful when making upcoming decisions.

2.name: The Magician
2.keywords: Focus; Resourceful; Power; Conscious Action; Skill
description: The Magician is the first card of the Tarot, representing beginnings and new opportunities.

Stepping into the card, we see the Magician standing upright with one hand pointing to the Universe, the other pointing to the ground. This gesture shows his connection between the spiritual world and the physical world. The Magician uses this connection to bring distant ideas down to reality. His white robe represents purity, while his red cloak shows deep knowledge and experience.
Above his head is the symbol of infinity (∞), and around his waist is a snake biting its own tail - a sign of unlimited energy.

On the table in front of him are the four main symbols of the Tarot deck - the cup, the pentacle, the sword, and the wand. Each item stands for an element: water, earth, air, and fire. This means he has all the tools he needs to carry out his plans.. The background full of plants and flowers shows the growth of new ideas and inspiration.
meaning: You already have the tools, resources, and energy you need to turn your dreams into reality. Everything you need is either right in front of you or already within your hand. You have willpower (fire), tools and ingredients (earth), intelligence (air), and emotions (water) to help you reach your goals. Now is the time to connect these things together to create something new - your dreams!
Opportunities are coming your way - grab them! All the skills and knowledge you've gained from your journey are ready to help you turn your ideas into reality.

On the journey to achieving your dreams, always remember that you must have a clear plan. Don’t act only from ego, money, or fame. You need to connect your soul with your goals. Use your creativity to open the door ahead.

Once you’ve prepared all of these things above, believe in your power. You can be a pioneer, a leader, or an inspiration to others with your vision and abilities. So stay true to your purpose and keep your mind clear, this will help you stay on the right path and avoid being led astray.
reMeaning: The reversed Magician shows that you want to discover something, but you haven’t started yet. You have all the tools, but you don’t know how to use them. Try asking people around you, especially those who have already succeeded.

If you've already started, this card may show that your ideas are unclear so that you may feel lost or distracted. Maybe you’ve gone off track from your original goal, or it no longer motivates you. Now you might be missing the will and focus to finish your mission. You may be distracted by things around you.

At its worst, the reversed Magician can represent greed, tricks, and manipulation. You might be on the right path, but if your heart isn’t steady and your spirit isn’t strong, you will be manipulated by temptations and become a selfish person, only thinking about yourself. Be careful, don’t lose your way!

Moreover, this card might also say that you have many talents and skills, but you’re not using them all. Maybe you've let your lack of confidence hold you back. Don't hesitate, remember, success only comes when you dare to change.. Or maybe you still need to learn some important skills to reach success. So go back inside, observe and make your next move!

3.name: The High Priestess
description: Stepping into the card, the High Priestess is wearing a blue robe with a cross on her chest and a horned crown on her head. These symbols show her deep wisdom, strong intuition, and connection to the spiritual world. She holds a scroll with the word TORA. Part of it is hidden, meaning that this knowledge is both clear and secret. It can only be understood by connecting through intuition, beyond normal words. The crescent moon at her feet shows her link to feminine energy, the subconscious mind, and intuition, as well as the moon’s natural cycle.

Behind her is a thin veil decorated with pomegranates. This veil stands for the line between what we can see and what is hidden - between the conscious and unconscious mind. The pomegranates symbolize abundance, growth, and divine feminine energy.

Beside the High Priestess are two large pillars. They mark the entrance to a holy temple (inspired by Solomon’s Temple). One pillar is black with the letter 'B' for Boaz. It stands for stillness, mystery, and emotions. The other pillar is white with the letter 'J' for Jachin, standing for action, clarity, and logic. The black and white colors represent opposites—light and dark, emotion and reason. To enter this sacred space, you must understand and accept both sides.
meaning: While The Magician represents the power of the conscious mind and the physical world, the High Priestess guards the subconscious and teaches sacred knowledge and hidden truths. She tells you that the world is not always what it seems. She lifts the curtain of basic understanding and gives you deep, intuitive knowledge about the Universe and its mysteries.

This card is a sign of spiritual awakening, inner guidance, knowledge, and wisdom. When the High Priestess appears, the space between you and the magical world becomes thinner. You have the chance to connect with the deep wisdom inside your soul. The answers you’re looking for are already within you. Try to listen to your intuition by meditating or writing down your dreams.

Right now, your intuition is giving you helpful messages. It’s helping you get closer to your subconscious. Take time to be quiet and calm. Meditate and listen to your inner voice—it might have the answers you need. Trust your own feelings and thoughts. This is the time to grow your spiritual side. The more you listen to your intuition, the stronger it becomes, and the more confident you will feel.

The High Priestess reminds you of your compassion, empathy, and inner wisdom. No matter who you are, it’s important to balance your energy. Don’t hide your ability to care, trust, feel, and understand others. Be proud of these qualities—they are your strengths.
3.keywords: Intuition; Spiritual awareness; Divine feminine; Subconscious
3.reKeywords: Secrets; Disconnected from intuition; Drained energy; Silence
reMeaning: The High Priestess reversed reminds you to listen to your inner voice and wisdom. Maybe you're being influenced by others or too involved in someone else’s problem, forgetting to care for yourself. Now is the time to step back, be quiet, and listen to what your inner voice is trying to say.

You might be struggling to trust your own intuition. You feel disconnected from it. But remember—your intuition is a special power. It’s always there to guide and help you. Trust the Universe and allow yourself to connect to this endless source of energy. Know that the High Priestess lives inside you—she will always be there when you need her. When you're feeling stressed, meditate and calm your mind so you can hear her advice. The answers will come once you clear your mind and let your intuition speak.

Lastly, the reversed High Priestess may also mean that someone could be using your secrets or spreading rumors. Instead of guessing what’s happening, try to observe clearly, talk directly, and solve the problem calmly.

4.name: The Empress
description: Stepping into the card, a beautiful woman with long blonde hair is sitting on a soft red velvet throne. She holds a scepter in her hand, symbolizing stability, power, and control. On her head is a crown with twelve stars, showing her connection to the universe, natural cycles (like 12 months of the year), or the 12 zodiac signs. Her robe has pomegranate patterns, a symbol of fertility. Below the throne is a shield with the symbol of Venus - the planet of love, beauty, creativity, birth, and charm.

Behind her is a thick, green forest. A flowing stream surrounds her, showing her deep connection with Mother Nature and life. She feels peace from the trees, the water, and gets new energy from nature. In front, you can see golden wheat growing from the ground - a sign of a good harvest. All of this shows richness, growth, and the power to take care of others.
meaning: The Empress represents a strong connection to the feminine energy inside each of us. It is elegance, love, birth, creativity, and care -  important for bringing balance to life. This card asks you to connect with your gentle, loving side.

This may be the perfect time to try something creative or artistic. Connect with your senses and enjoy simple pleasures. Maybe treat yourself to a spa day, massage, a nice meal, or quality time with someone you love. Try creative activities like painting, music, or any form of art.

The Empress also stands for abundance. You are now seeing the results of your hard work, and your dreams are starting to come true. It may not be about money – it could be love or life experiences. Think about all the good things around you and be thankful. Gratitude will bring more good things to your life.

As Mother Earth, The Empress advises you to go outside and connect with nature. Go to a forest, beach, mountain, or lake. Sit there for a few minutes, hours, or even a whole day to feel peace and gain new inspiration from the trees, flowers, and nature around you. This card also encourages you to care for your living space and the environment.

The Empress also means new life or growth. This could be a sign of pregnancy, or the birth of a new idea or project. Grow your creative ideas with care and love. You may feel the need to protect and care deeply - for a child, your creative work, or something personal to you.
reMeaning: You may feel stuck or out of ideas, especially when starting something new. You may worry if your idea is good enough. But for now, stop thinking about others’ opinions. Focus on your own energy and let your creativity flow, no matter how it looks.

You might have forgotten yourself while caring too much for others. Now is the time to give love to yourself. Start a creative project just for you. Focus on what makes you happy. Only when you are full of love can you truly care for others with kindness.

If you feel disconnected from nature, this is the perfect time to spend a few hours outside - maybe at the beach, in a park, or your garden. Look at the beauty and life in small things. Try noticing the new leaves on a tree or the bright colors of plants around you.
In your relationships, you may be too protective or controlling. If so, now is the time to allow more independence and trust, while still showing love.

5.name: The Emperor
description: If The Empress is the Mother of the Tarot deck, then The Emperor is the Father.

Stepping into the card, a man - possibly a king - is sitting on a large stone throne, decorated with four ram heads. These rams connect him with Aries and Mars, symbols of strong will and leadership. He holds an Ankh scepter in his right hand, a symbol of life in Egyptian culture, and a globe in his left hand, showing his rule over the world.

He wears a red robe, which stands for power, passion, and life energy. Underneath, he wears armor to protect himself from attack or danger. His long white beard shows age and experience. His golden crown confirms his authority and desire to be respected.

Behind him are tall, rocky mountains, showing his firm ideas, wisdom, and strong base. But they also remind us that change is possible when needed. A river flows beneath him, showing that while he may seem cold and strict, he still has deep emotions. It just takes time, trust, and effort to reach that softer side of him.
meaning: The Emperor is the Father figure in the Tarot, reminding you that you may be playing a fatherly role - protecting your family or loved ones. You might be the foundation that supports those around you.

You may have some form of power or control in your current situation. Now is the time to lead. Make clear and strong decisions. You know what you want to achieve, and you know how to manage people and tasks to get there. This doesn’t mean you ignore others' ideas – listen to them – but you’ll need to make the final call.

You likely create your own rules and apply them in different situations. You solve problems calmly by breaking them into smaller steps, analyzing clearly, and deciding what actions to take. You have a strong foundation and logical thinking. Keep handling things with structure and strategy. Stay steady with your plans.

The Emperor also stands for wisdom about the world. You’ve gained experience through the years, and now you enjoy guiding others. You could be a mentor, a boss, or a good friend – someone who wants to share your best lessons so others can grow too.
reMeaning: The reversed Emperor warns that you may be acting too controlling or strict in your thinking. You might be forcing your views on others, which can make them feel trapped or upset. Or, it might be the opposite - someone is controlling you. Take a step back and use your power with kindness and fairness. You don’t need to control others, and you shouldn’t let others control you.

Others may see you as a leader or expert in your field, but you might be avoiding that role. Maybe you don’t want to be seen as the boss and prefer staying quiet. That’s okay, just find a way to lead or create value in your own style.

Sometimes, though, you need to step up and take charge. You might be stuck in a strict environment that doesn’t fit you anymore. It could be time to start your own project or look for a job where you can be more creative and free.

If you're having relationship issues, the reversed Emperor suggests an imbalance. One person may be too dominant, controlling, or strict. The other might have lost their freedom, causing stress and blocking the healthy flow of energy in the relationship.

This card can also mean you’re becoming disorganized or lacking self-discipline. Plans are falling apart. You feel unsure about your goals and delay important tasks. If this is true, take a deep breath and calm down. Use your solid base and experience to list what needs fixing. Break it down, analyze, and organize it. Go back to your original goal or find a new one that fits better  and stay focused. Bring back your natural discipline!
5.reKeywords: Controlling; Abuse of power; Lack of discipline; Rigidity; Rebellion

6.name: The Hierophant
description: The Hierophant is the male form of The High Priestess. This card is also known as the Pope or the Teacher in other Tarot decks.

Stepping into the card, you see a wise priest sitting in a holy temple (this temple is different from the one of The High Priestess). He wears a ceremonial robe in red, blue, and white, and a tall crown with three levels. These show his power in three worlds: the conscious, the unconscious, and the spiritual. His left hand holds a staff with a cross of three bars, showing his strong role in religion. His right hand is raised to give blessings, with two fingers pointing to the sky and two to the earth.

Kneeling in front of him are two followers. His job is to teach them so they can do their roles. This image shows joining a group or organization that shares the same goals and values. Two crossed keys at his feet represent balance between knowledge and feelings, and the ability to unlock secrets that only he can teach.
meaning: Now might be a good time to follow trusted traditions (but not old and unfair ones). You should not try new ways if you are not sure. For example, if you want to learn something new, look for teachers with experience. Study deep and true knowledge that is already tested. When you share ideas with others, do it step by step, using clear methods. Do not try to change rules without reason.

This card can also mean being part of a group or team. You may feel happy working with people who have clear rules. You may visit a church, temple, or join a religion, or simply take part in an online study group. Working in teams can help you learn from others.
reMeaning: You may want to break free from hard-to-understand rules. Maybe you followed your feelings and others, but now you see it’s time to change. If so, let yourself make your own rules. You are now leading yourself. The knowledge you need may not come from outside. At first, this can feel hard and confusing, but in time, you will learn to trust yourself and use your own experiences. Forget what others say and focus on you. This is not about denying good traditions, but about adding new ideas to old ones. Trust your inner voice and light your own path.

You may have new ways of thinking and are open to try ideas that are different from what you were taught is 'true'. You no longer accept strict rules around you. Instead, you want to find new ways. If you feel trapped and not free, this is your time to make your own way.

7.name: The Lovers
description: Stepping into the card, a naked man and woman stand beneath the angel Raphael – the angel of healing. He blesses the couple and reminds them of their connection to Heaven.

The Lovers stand in a beautiful setting that reminds us of the Garden of Eden. Behind the woman is a tall apple tree with a snake wrapped around it. This shows the temptation of physical pleasures that led to their fall from Eden. Behind the man is a 'tree of fire', showing passion – the man's main focus. The twelve flames represent the twelve zodiac signs, symbolizing eternal time. The man looks at the woman, who looks at the angel. This shows the path from the conscious mind to the subconscious and then to the higher self, or from physical desire to emotional need to spiritual growth. The fiery mountain in the background reminds us of the 'eruption' of 'desire' when lovers meet in complete nakedness.
meaning: The Lovers represents meaningful relationships and conscious connections. You may have a strong, beautiful bond with loved ones. It can be a new relationship, a deep emotional connection, or a long-lasting partnership. It can also mean a close friendship or a loving family bond. You are guided to express yourself honestly and openly to build a relationship based on trust and respect.

The Lovers also talks about knowing your values and beliefs. You are discovering what matters most to you. After learning and reflecting, you are ready to build your own belief system. This is a good time to step into the world and make your own choices. Always be true to yourself and stay honest in everything you do!

One key meaning of The Lovers is choice. You may be facing a situation that tests your morals. Think carefully before you act and consider all the outcomes. To make the right decision, understand your own values or seek higher guidance. Don’t choose based on fear, shame, or worry.

The Lovers may also encourage you to balance opposites to create harmony. Use both your mind and your heart when making choices. Each option may have good and bad sides, with both chances and challenges. When you accept both sides, you can create something whole and peaceful.
reMeaning: Reversed, The Lovers may show disconnection with those around you, especially loved ones. If you and your partner no longer connect, think about why you started. If you still love them deeply, know this moment will pass. The best thing you can do is show your love – steady and true. But if the relationship feels stuck, full of fights and lacking respect, it may be time to let go. Respect yourself and do what is best for both of you.

The reversed Lovers can also mean imbalance. One person may have stronger feelings than the other, which can cause hurt and fear. You may hesitate to open your heart because you're afraid of getting hurt.

You might be facing hard decisions with serious consequences. You may want to choose what benefits you most now and avoid responsibility. But think again – choose what is best for everyone and your true future, even if it’s hard.

The reversed Lovers also remind you to love yourself. If you keep comparing yourself to others, remember: you see good things in them because you also have those qualities inside you. Let your inner power shine and become your best self.

You may have inner conflict or guilt about something from the past. Be honest, say sorry sincerely, and forgive yourself. If it feels too heavy, talk to a trusted therapist. In the future, make decisions based on your personal values and beliefs. They will guide you to better choices.
7.keywords: Harmony; Relationships; Love; Honesty; Values; Choices

8.name: The Chariot
8.reKeywords: Lack of direction; Losing focus; Obstacles; Trying to control
description: Stepping into the card, the most striking image is a brave warrior standing in a chariot. His armor is decorated with crescent moons, symbolizing creation, a square on his chest showing strong willpower, and alchemical symbols representing spiritual transformation. The laurel wreath and star crown stand for victory, success, and rising above challenges. Although it looks like he’s driving the chariot, he holds no reins - only a wand similar to The Magician’s, meaning he leads with his mind and inner strength.

The warrior stands tall, ready to move forward. The canopy above him is covered in stars, showing his connection to the universe. In front of the chariot are two sphinxes - one black, one white - symbolizing duality or opposing forces. They pull in different directions, but the warrior uses his willpower and determination to guide the chariot forward. Behind the chariot is a wide river - the flow of life. The city walls across the river show he has left behind material comfort to chase spiritual values.
meaning: You’ve made choices that align with your values from The Lovers card, and now you are acting on them. You’ve set clear goals and are using your inner strength to make them real. The Chariot is a sign that success is possible if you stay disciplined, confident, and focused. Don’t rush or skip steps. Instead, see this as a challenge to your strength and determination. Victory is within reach, but it depends on you.

You must maintain strict self-discipline. Stay focused on your goals and don’t let outside distractions or inner doubts pull you off track. Challenges may arise: you may feel torn in different directions, or others may discourage you. But staying focused on what matters will help you move past these obstacles. Use all your inner energy to steer the chariot. Let the struggle fuel your drive forward.
The Chariot can also suggest a physical journey. If time and money allow, consider traveling to learn and expand your horizons.
reMeaning: Reversed, The Chariot may warn you to be careful with an important project. You might need to ‘turn the chariot’ or change your plan. You may feel unmotivated or doubt the outcome. Take time to reassess. Are there signs you need a new direction? What deeper reasons might be making things harder than expected?

Sometimes, challenges are blocking your path and holding you back from your goals. Everything feels too hard, and your willpower may not be strong enough. If that’s the case, take a break and remind yourself why you wanted this goal in the first place.

You may feel like things are out of your control. Ask yourself - are you trying to control things that aren’t really in your hands? If so, stop and let them go. Focus on what is within your control and look for ways to improve your situation.

There may be hidden conflicts or inner struggles making you feel overwhelmed. You’re trying to hold everything tightly, but it may be time to loosen your grip and let things unfold naturally. Accept help, and be grateful for the support you receive, even if it doesn’t look exactly how you expected.

9.name: Strength
9.keywords: Strength; Taming the inner beast; Patience; Compassion; Perseverance
9.reKeywords: Lack of confidence; Self - doubt; Impulsiveness; Abuse of power
description: Stepping into the card, we see a gentle woman softly petting a lion. She has tamed this wild beast with patience and love. The lion represents passions and physical desires. She doesn’t use force but controls the lion with kindness and care. The woman wears a white robe, symbolizing purity of the soul. Her belt and flower crown show the beauty and harmony of nature. Above her head is the infinity symbol, showing her unlimited wisdom and potential.
meaning: Strength is about inner strength and willpower to overcome difficulties. You are able to endure life’s challenges. You have stamina and patience. You know what you are doing, and you do it with care and skill.

Strength reminds you to 'tame the beast' inside you. You might feel angry, sad, frustrated, or ashamed in some situations. But the important thing is how you respond to those feelings. This is not the time to act on anger or hate. Instead, look at the situation with compassion, kindness, and patience. One way to handle emotions is to observe them as they arise, instead of focusing on what upsets you. You can seek help from a therapist or join a retreat to face those negative emotions.

You have strong willpower and determination. You don’t need to control others forcefully - use patience and persuasion instead. Like the woman in the card, you can handle any situation with inner calm. Real strength comes from compassion, softness, and the ability to inspire others.

You have the confidence and strength to overcome fear and challenges. Put aside what scares you. If you’ve been through hard times and feel drained, give yourself time to rest. Meditate and reflect on your thoughts. You will find the way through. You are ready to stand up and be there for others. Keep your determination and stay strong.
reMeaning: You might feel insecure and afraid. If you’ve just failed at something, you may feel hurt and lose faith. But remember, your true strength is always with you, and now is the time to reconnect with it. In reality, you are stronger and more resilient than you think. So be kind to yourself. Bring back your confidence. Think about the times you succeeded and use that courage to move forward.

Reversed Strength can show that you’re feeling very stressed, aggressive, or quick-tempered. You may act without thinking and know it could lead to problems. What you need now is to learn how to transform your anger instead of hiding it.

Reversed Strength may also mean you’re losing patience with your project. Things might feel hard, and you want to quit. Go back to your original goal, why did you start? If you feel tired and burnt out, especially after working hard to help others or to achieve something that didn’t work out, it’s time to recharge. Treat yourself to a trip or a break. Or simply go to a park, forest, or lake and breathe in nature. Remember, only with patience and persistence will you succeed.

Sometimes, you may be misusing your power. Are you being too bossy or trying to control others? Take a moment to reflect and return to balance. Use your strength to help others speak up instead of silencing them. Open your heart and let compassion flow through you.

10.name: The Hermit
10.keywords: Soul searching; Inner reflection; Solitude; Inner guidance
10.reKeywords: Isolation; Avoidance; Ignoring inner voice; Distrust
description: Stepping into the card, a hermit stands alone on top of a mountain. The snow-covered peak represents his spiritual growth, mastery, and accomplishments. He has chosen the path of self-discovery and reached a higher level of awareness. In his right hand, he holds a lantern with a six-pointed star, a symbol of wisdom. The lantern lights up his path — but only a few steps ahead, not the whole way. He must keep walking to know where to go next. In his left hand, the hermit holds a long staff (a symbol of power and authority), which he uses for support and guidance.
meaning: You are being called to explore your inner world and reflect deeply. This is a time to think about your motivations, values, and personal beliefs, and connect with your true self. Leave behind distractions and begin a journey of self-discovery. It may feel lonely because you are searching within, not outside. When you connect with your inner light, you will hear the answers you need and grow wiser. Light your own torch and let your wisdom guide you. You may not see the whole path, but you will see enough to take the next step. Move carefully, one step at a time.

You might be at a turning point in life. Through meditation and quiet time, you can reflect on what really matters to you. This may lead you to review your goals or even change direction. Look at your life with deep understanding, and you may realize that your priorities need to shift. Take your time, be thoughtful, and don’t rush into any quick decisions.

You may be going through a challenge. Now is the time to rely on your own experience and wisdom to find the answer. Listen to your inner voice and trust yourself — you will find the strength to overcome it.
reMeaning: If you’ve been spending a lot of time alone, the reversed Hermit suggests you may be feeling too isolated. Are you pushing people away? You might be closing yourself off too much. Try to reconnect with those around you. Don’t focus only on yourself and forget your family or friends.

You may also be avoiding problems or responsibilities. You don't want to face the truth. You isolate yourself to escape the outside world. If this sounds like you, it’s time to open up, accept your mistakes, and take responsibility. Be brave and face reality. You might also need help from a therapist or counselor.

If you’re having trouble connecting with your inner self, try to give yourself more time and space to reflect. This is the moment to look within and reconnect with your life’s deeper purpose. Maybe you’ve been too busy with work or daily life, and you’ve ignored your inner voice.

The Hermit reversed can also show imbalance in a relationship. One person might be too controlling. You both need to trust each other and give space — but also be there when support is needed. Even though the relationship has problems, neither of you wants to give up. If that's true, talk honestly, share your concerns, and find a respectful, caring way to move forward together.

11.name: Wheel Of Fortune
11.reKeywords: Karma; Impermanence; Causality; Resistance; Acceptance and Learning; Escaping Negativity
description: Upon examining the card, we see a giant wheel. Four Hebrew letters are engraved on the wheel's surface: י (Yod), ה (He), ו (Vav), ה (He), which together spell יהוה (YHVH, read from right to left), the name of God. Interspersed are the Latin letters TORA, meaning "law". or read in reverse as TAROT (if the T of the next circle is connected), or even ROTA, meaning "wheel". In the center of the wheel are alchemical symbols of mercury, sulfur, water, and salt—the building elements of life and four elements representing the forces of creation.

Surrounding the wheel are three creatures: the serpent, representing the Egyptian god Typhon (the god of evil); next is Anubis, the Egyptian god of the underworld; and atop the wheel is the Sphinx, a symbol of knowledge and strength.

At the four corners of the Wheel of Fortune card are four winged mythical creatures, each representing one of the four Fixed signs of the zodiac: the angel is Aquarius, the falcon is Scorpio, the lion is Leo, and the bull is Taurus. Their wings represent stability amidst movement and change. Additionally, all four creatures hold the Torah, symbols of wisdom.
meaning: If you feel stuck in a difficult situation, believe that those negative things are impermanent – ​​they won't last forever. Keep a clear mind and move forward strongly; all difficulties will eventually pass! Conversely, if you are too engrossed in pleasures, remember that these things are also impermanent. You shouldn't cling too much to any state, because whether good or bad, they will all change. Instead, learn to accept change, learn to adapt, and face the ebb and flow of things. But that doesn't mean ignoring what you have. Because things are impermanent, we should cherish and be grateful for the moments we have together.

If you're someone who lives a stable life, the Wheel of Fortune can be a shock. It seems the Universe is creating anything and everything, and you can't control or predict it. This is one of the card's unpredictable elements because no matter which way the wheel turns, you can't change it. At this point, you need to accept what's happening and adapt to it, instead of trying to hold onto things that can no longer be held.

The Wheel of Fortune also reminds you of the law of cause and effect – the inevitable law of the Universe. Be a good and loving person, and good things will come to you. If you want happiness and prosperity, make sure you are sending positive things out into the Universe. What you send into the Universe will come back to you.

This card also signals a significant turning point in your life. Unexpected opportunities may arise, potentially changing your path considerably. While this may seem new, consider it an invitation from the Universe to boldly turn things around and branch off into a promising new direction. It might be challenging, but always maintain an optimistic attitude and trust that the Universe will arrange things in the best way for you. Your life is about to shift in a more positive direction, provided you are willing to grow and improve yourself. Always pay attention to the signs from the Universe, and the miracles that are about to happen. Don't hesitate to open your heart and accept help from outside, whether material or spiritual. Teachers and mentors are always willing to support you when you need it; connect with them.
reMeaning: You may be facing unexpected changes or sudden negative events that leave you feeling utterly helpless. This is not the time to wallow in despair; take action to improve the situation. View this period as an opportunity to regain control of your life and get things back on track. Focus on the positive, do good deeds, cultivate virtue, and show love, and things will soon get better! Always remember, no challenge lasts forever!

It's possible that this difficult time is a consequence of past mistakes. Reflect on which actions contributed to this 'crisis'? Remember this lesson and don't repeat it in the future. Take responsibility for the present and focus on rebuilding your positive life. Right now, don't dwell on self-blame; instead, think positively. You can volunteer, participate in good deeds, and sow good seeds for the future. And don't hesitate to seek help from those around you if needed – you're not alone in this world!

Perhaps you are resisting change. It seems like you don't want it to happen, you feel forced. This change may have caused stress, and you are trying to prevent it. But calm down and accept that change is inevitable. You will have better experiences when you adapt to it.

The reversed Wheel of Fortune also suggests that you may have put an end to the persistent negativity in your life. Perhaps you've discovered which of your actions created a cycle, and now you're ready to break free.

12.name: Justice
12.keywords: Justice; Fairness; Trust; Cause and Effect; Balance
12.reKeywords: Injustice; Irresponsibility; Lack of facts; Legal issue
description: Entering the card, a woman appears majestic. She holds a sword in her right hand, representing logic in her thinking. The sword pointing upwards signifies final decision-making, and like a double-edged sword, it suggests that action always has consequences. In her left hand is a scale, representing fairness and symbolizing her integrity.

She wore a crown, and upon closer inspection, a blue square was visible, representing sequential thoughts. Her red cloak symbolized the determination to deliver justice. A white shoe peeked out from under her dress, suggesting that everyone makes mistakes and is imperfect, but the important thing is to take responsibility.
She sits before a purple cloth, symbolizing compassion. The two pillars on either side are similar to those in the High Priestess or Hierophant cards, representing justice, law, and order.
meaning: Always remember that every action has consequences, and you will reap what you sow. If you have good intentions, benefiting those around you, there's nothing to worry about. But if the opposite is true, you must be cautious with your actions. However, the Justice card isn't just a dry, black and white card; it also represents empathy and compassion. Even if you've done something you regret, you will still be treated fairly and impartially. But remember, you need to maintain integrity, uphold the law, and always be responsible for your actions and their consequences.

You may be facing an important choice. You need to consider it carefully because it affects your long-term future and the future of those around you. Analyze clearly, weigh the advantages and disadvantages, combine this with your personal values ​​and purpose in life, to make the best choice. Continue to evaluate and analyze until you are certain of your choice and you are sure you will not regret it. You shouldn't rush at this time.

If you are seeking justice, the Justice card is a positive sign that your wish will be granted soon. You may be part of a case awaiting a final verdict from the legal authorities. A verdict will be delivered soon! Once a final decision is made, you need to accept it and move on!

Furthermore, the Justice card speaks of balance in all aspects of life. If you are becoming too focused on one side or the other, return to a state of balance. You may need to see a mental health professional for counseling or seek help from those around you.
reMeaning: Remember, whatever you do, you must live with its consequences. Perhaps you've made a mistake. Are you hiding it and hoping no one will know? Or are you not ready to take responsibility for your actions? If so, remember that it will provide you with valuable lessons. Be brave enough to admit your mistakes and focus on correcting them. This will help you feel freed from guilt and shame. It will be a lesson that helps you grow and make wiser decisions in the future.

The reversed Justice card suggests that you may be judging yourself too harshly. Are you becoming too critical and self-deprecating after setbacks? Try to forgive yourself, understand the root of the problem, then bandage your wounds and get back on your feet. Only when you accept learning from your mistakes and are forgiving of yourself can you grow in the future.

If you're considering an important decision that could affect others, be careful of biases or preconceived notions about that person that could make the decision unfair. You should gather additional information to arrive at a more informed and fair decision.

If you're involved in a legal issue and fear an unfair outcome or a dispute over the final judgment, always closely monitor the process and thoroughly analyze the whole picture. There may be complex legal issues or obstacles hindering the delivery of justice.

13.name: The Hanged Man
13.keywords: Pause; Letting go; New perspective; Serenity
description: The card depicts a man hanging upside down from a tree. He views the world from a completely different perspective. His face is calm, as if this posture is his choice. A halo surrounds his head, representing understanding, awareness, and enlightenment. His right leg is tied to the tree, while his left knee is bent and placed behind his right leg. His hands are folded behind his back, forming an inverted triangle. The man wears red pants, symbolizing passion and the physical body. His blue shirt represents knowledge. The Hanged Man card is the ultimate card of letting go, of sacrificing oneself for a greater good.
meaning: Perhaps you should take some time to pause your routines and embrace a new way of thinking and perspective. Certainly, you may have to let go of some important things, but it will be worth it. This is how the Universe helps you gain new perspectives and prepare you for the next upgrade happening in your life. You will encounter obstacles if you resist this change. Instead, let the opportunities flow smoothly to you. Maintain serenity and calmness in the face of these changes.

The Hanged Man offers an important reminder: to truly move forward, sometimes you need to stop and let go of things that no longer fit. The mindsets or behaviors that once brought you to where you are may no longer be suitable for guiding you toward the future. The key is that this letting go should be a voluntary choice, stemming from a connection with your intuition. If you listen to your inner signals, you'll know when to pause to gain a fresh perspective and embrace unprecedented opportunities. However, if you ignore those signals, the Universe may intervene, forcing you to stop with obstacles, even at times you least expect.

Perhaps some of your ideas should be put on hold temporarily. Don't keep 'plunging headfirst' and believing that more power will get you there faster. Instead, pause to reflect and reassess the situation. Something new might be emerging, but if you don't give it enough time and space to develop, you won't see it.

You may be feeling stuck or at a dead end. This suggests you're resisting the natural flow, and the card is urging you to let go of control and accept your current circumstances. Instead of stubbornly resisting, allow yourself to go with the flow. Furthermore, The Hanged Man encourages you to change your perspective and energy. Try doing something different, even if it's just a small action like changing your daily routine, taking a course, or moving. These things will help you refresh your energy and open up a better way of life.
reMeaning: You may understand that you should slow down, pause for a while. But you're resisting. You're forcing yourself to complete so many tasks and projects, keeping yourself busy and distracting yourself from the real issues that need your attention. Your body and mind are telling you to slow down, but your mind keeps going. Pause and rest before it's too late. Rearrange your schedule and make more time and space for rest and relaxation.

You may have been in a situation where things are stagnating, making you very frustrated. You feel helpless because you can't do anything further as things seem to be going out of control. Let go of your attachment to the idea that things need to go the way you expect. Instead of waiting for everyone on the team to be free on a given day to discuss, split into smaller groups with shared free time to work, then combine. Go with the flow of life, even if it's not what you expect. When will it ever get back on track?

If your life has slowed down for a while, the reversed Hanged Man is a positive sign that you're ready to move forward with a new perspective and energy. You may find that things are more orderly, easier to accept, and flow more smoothly, and you're ready to move on. There may have been a breakthrough shift in how you think and work. You're prepared to make those changes and move forward with renewed energy.

The reversed Hanged Man can also be a sign that you are hesitating before making a decision or taking action. You think you're waiting until you feel completely ready. But perhaps that absolute readiness will never come. Don't wait any longer, make a decision. Just a glimmer of readiness is enough, don't wait any longer. Act before the Universe stops waiting for you.

14.name: Death
description: Stepping onto the card, the image that stands out is that of Death – a skeleton in black armor, riding a white horse. The skeleton represents the longest-lasting part of the body after death. The armor symbolizes invincibility and signifies that death will come regardless; its black color represents sorrow and mystery. The horse, on the other hand, represents purity and symbolizes strength and power. Death holds a black flag adorned with a white rose, five petals – representing beauty, purification, and immortality – and the number 13 – representing misfortune, but also change. In short, these symbols reveal that death is not just an end. Death is also a beginning, birth and rebirth, change and transformation. There exists a strange beauty in death, and it is an integral part of life.

A royal figure appears dead on the ground, while a young woman, a child, and a bishop plead with Death to spare them. But, as we all know, death spares no one. It is the law of life: birth, existence, transformation, and destruction. Behind them, a boat glides on the river, like the boats in legends that carry the dead to the underworld. On the horizon, the sun sets between two towers (also appearing in The Moon Leaf), symbolizing the day-night cycle: light ends each night and is 'reborn' each morning.

The Death card is undoubtedly the most feared and misunderstood card in the Tarot deck. Just mentioning the name 'Death' is enough to send shivers down people's spines, making them fear bad luck after encountering this card. But calm down, the Death card is quite the opposite; it seems to be one of the most positive cards in the deck!
meaning: After a moment of pause and reflection with The Hanged Man, the Death card represents the end of a significant phase or aspect of your life that you realize is no longer beneficial. Closing one door to open another. You close the past, look to the future, and are ready to embrace new opportunities. You may find it difficult to let go of the past, but you will soon see its importance. If you resist this necessary ending, you may experience pain, both mental and physical. But if you focus on creativity, you allow new things to flourish within you.

Similarly, Death indicates this is a crucial time for transformation and transition. You need to change yourself and let go of the old. Any change should be welcomed as a positive, cleansing, and refreshing experience for your life. Ending and removing limiting elements can open the door to a better, more fulfilling life experience. This is the time to reshape yourself!

The Death card has elements of sudden change. Death happens to everyone, regardless of who you are; it's similar to a sudden change. Therefore, Death can be a sign that you may feel as though you are caught in the middle of a path of change and unable to escape its impact. Although the upheaval may seem undesirable and painful, it will bring you a series of unexpected opportunities and new advantages.

Ultimately, Death is a signal that you need to learn to let go of unhealthy things in your life, paving the way for a fuller, happier life with more meaning. Death teaches you to let go of a lifestyle that no longer suits you. This is a perfect card for breaking a bad habit. Consider this the time to let go of what is unnecessary in your life.
reMeaning: The reversed Death card indicates you are standing at the threshold of positive change, but are resisting it. Perhaps you are hesitant, reluctant to let go of familiar things, or simply don't know how to make the necessary transformation. Your clinging to old, even toxic, viewpoints or habits from the past is hindering new opportunities and causing stagnation and directionlessness. Embrace change instead of avoiding it. Imagine the wonderful things that will come when you dare to let go of the past – the future only truly becomes brighter when you are ready to move forward. Start with the smallest changes in your daily life, such as waking up early for a run, or simply going to bed earlier each night. These small steps will help you break through stagnation and open yourself to rebirth.

The reversed Death card sometimes indicates that you are undergoing a profound and significant personal transformation, a powerful inner metamorphosis that may not yet be outwardly apparent. You are quietly shedding what no longer serves you, gradually creating space for new and better things to emerge. This could be a time of releasing fears, breaking old barriers, profoundly changing habits, or undergoing a physical and mental cleansing and transformation through positive healing therapies. Guide and benefit others in this process once you feel truly 'reborn'.

15.name: Temperance
15.keywords: Balance; Moderation; Patience; Long-term goals; Harmony
description: Upon examining the card, we see the image of an androgynous angel (Hermaphrodite). The halo above her head represents enlightenment, wisdom, and peace achieved through balance and the middle way. She wears a white robe with a triangle within a square in front, signifying that humanity is within the Earth and follows the laws of nature. The angel stands balanced with one foot on a rock and the other in the water, representing the need to remain steadfast but also to follow the flow. She pours water back and forth between two cups, skillfully and continuously adjusting the liquid to achieve optimal balance.

Behind it is a winding road up the mountain range, representing the journey of life. Suspended atop the mountain is a golden crown enveloped in radiant light, symbolizing the pursuit of a noble path and fidelity to life's purpose and meaning.
meaning: Temperance reminds you to always remain calm even when things get chaotic and stressful. Maintain stability in your energy, restore your inner flow to regain order and harmony in your life.

You've learned to control your emotions and maintain a stable mood, so that small things no longer easily bother you. This ability to be patient, along with keeping yourself balanced and peaceful, is the key to achieving deep joy and serenity in life.

Temperance advises you to remain neutral during this time. Now is not the time for extreme opinions or arguments. Be a peacemaker and avoid extremism. Be someone who helps bring people together to create harmony and cooperation. By working together, you will leverage and learn from the strength of the collective. Additionally, Temperance recommends being flexible in getting along with people. Blend different elements together, such as leveraging the strengths of each individual in the same project to increase work efficiency.

The Temperance card shows that you have a clear, long-term vision of what you want to achieve. You don't rush things; instead, you take your time to ensure you handle each task as best as you can. You know that you need the right guidance to reach your goals.

You are learning a lot from what you have and you are happy with what you are doing. Everything seems to be falling into place. Your inner voice has guided you to positive results, and you are always patiently listening and following it.
reMeaning: If you've recently experienced prolonged 'overload,' the reverse Temperance is a warning that you need to restore balance and moderation as soon as possible. Perhaps you're living immoderately (for example, frequent drinking, constant overspending, overworking, or dwelling on negative thoughts). These things are pushing you away from your purpose in life. It's time to stop them and return to your original healthy lifestyle. Everything needs moderation!

When Temperance reverses, it warns of impatience and haste. You may be trying to skip steps. This can easily lead to impulsive, ill-considered decisions, causing unnecessary imbalance and stress in your life. Focus on your long-term vision and noble purpose, and remember that lasting achievements take time and moderation. Don't rush; trust in the flow of the process.

Reverse temperance can reflect a period of introspection, where you might re-evaluate your life's priorities. You might change your lifestyle, relationships, career, and even daily habits to cultivate balance and focus more on your new priorities. Don't be surprised if you experience tension or even conflict as you allow your inner world to harmonize with the outer world. It's a natural part of the growth process and creates positive change.

The reversed Temperance card also represents self-healing. By creating balance and moderation in your life, you are healing yourself. You do it in private, unaffected by those around you, and you know what you need to heal and create flow in your life.

16.name: The Devil
16.reKeywords: Freedom from limitations; Confronting oneself; Non-attachment
description: Upon entering the card, the most striking figure is a demon with a human body and a goat's head. He has bat wings, the blood-sucking creature symbolizing what happens when you give in to your desires. He has a hypnotic gaze, ready to bewitch and possess those who approach him. Above him is an inverted five-pointed star – representing dark magic. He raises his right hand in the 'Vulcan Salute' gesture. In his left hand, he holds a burning torch.

At his feet lay a man and a woman, both naked and chained to the platform where The Devil sat. At first glance, they appeared to be imprisoned there. But upon closer inspection, the chains around their necks were loose and could be easily removed. Each had small horns on their heads, like those of a demon, a sign that they were becoming more and more like him the longer they were there. Both had grown tails, another symbol of their animalistic side, and the grape and flame motifs on their tails respectively represented satisfaction and desire.
meaning: Are you being held back by negative forces? Perhaps you're trapped in a negative habit, behavior, mindset, or relationship. Maybe you're prioritizing short-term gains and neglecting long-term plans. These things are preventing you from becoming the best version of yourself. And you believe you're being controlled by them and can't break free. You believe you need them even though they're not positive and could harm you. At this point, you must recognize how these negative forces are manipulating you, and what the consequences have been, are, and will be for your life. This journey of self-transformation may be long, but the darkness will gradually dissipate when your light is strong enough. Focus your will and strength to liberate yourself. You have the capacity to do it!
The Devil can also indicate a strong bond between two people. However, be careful, because with The Devil, this healthy bond can become a dependence if you lose connection with your inner guidance.

The Devil can also represent your sexuality and wildness. You may be exploring new and the darkest aspects of yourself. If you can do this in a safe space, it can be an experience. However, it has the potential to become unsafe or harmful to your health in the long term. So, again, set clear boundaries, choose partners wisely, and be prepared to say no if necessary.
reMeaning: You may be at the final stage of a breakthrough or upgrade. You're about to reach your highest potential, but first, you need to let go of anything unhealthy or restrictive that might be holding you back. You must confront your darkness before you can step into your new version. It could be an addiction, unhealthy relationships, or a stagnant career. Let go of your fears and release any self-imposed limiting beliefs that are hindering your growth. It's easier than you think.

Right now you need to confront your inner fears and anxieties to free yourself from unhealthy constraints. Eliminate things you know are harmful to both your mind and body. You could adopt a healthier diet, reduce your phone use, quit smoking, spend more time with loved ones, or focus more on your goals. Take this opportunity to bring about positive change in your life by keeping your mind focused on the ultimate goal of inner peace.

The Reverse Devil can also appear when you venture into your deepest, darkest self – whether you're ready or not. If you actively seek this place out, you ensure you're armed and strong-willed enough to subdue your animalistic side. At this point, you dare to confront and accept your dark side in order to change. Conversely, if you accidentally find yourself in this dark spot, you suddenly realize that what you previously thought about yourself wasn't entirely true, you don't dare to face your negative aspects, and you feel stressed and anxious. If so, seek help from mental health professionals.

The Dalai Lama once said, 'Attachment is the root of suffering; therefore, it is the cause of all suffering.' Even in many other religions, non-attachment is a state of liberation from desires, attachments, and sorrows, and achieving inner peace. But this doesn't mean being indifferent or emotionless; it means no longer being dependent on unhealthy things. And you can practice mindful awareness, meditation, and self-reflection to achieve this state.

17.name: The Tower
17.keywords: Sudden change; Fluctuation; Chaos; Opening; Awakening
17.reKeywords: Change yourself; Fear of change; Avoid disaster
description: Upon reading the card, we see a tall, sturdy tower built atop a rocky mountain. A lightning strike sets the tower ablaze. Two people then jump out of a window. A chaotic scene unfolds, seemingly symbolizing destruction.

The tower was built solidly and securely. However, because it was built on unstable ground, a single lightning strike destroyed it. This speaks volumes about the ambition and goals that were flawed from the very foundations.

The lightning bolt represents a sudden burst of energy and understanding leading to a breakthrough or enlightenment. It strikes the top of the tower and causes the crown to fall, symbolizing energy flowing down from the Universe. Two desperate people jump from the burning tower, unaware of what awaits them afterward. Surrounding them are flames, representing truths revealed after the storm.
meaning: The Tower signifies unexpected events, changes, and chaos that have occurred or are about to occur. This could be a major, unforeseen event such as marital, financial, health, or work-related problems. The card emphasizes that there is no escape from it. Everything is happening to destroy, to shake you to the core, both physically and mentally, but the ultimate goal is still to help you grow.

If you're feeling peaceful, this will be 'a cold shower.' A bolt of clarity and understanding strikes down the lies and illusions you've told yourself or believed. The truth is revealed, making you realize that your past life was built on illusions and deception. Everything you thought was right has become wrong, and you feel disoriented as your core belief system is challenged.

The best way to move forward is to let this 'tower' be completely destroyed. At this moment, you have no choice but to accept the destruction and chaos, however painful it may be. This destruction is necessary for new things to flourish and for your soul to grow. You need to change your mindset and understand that this event is happening to help you.

The Tower represents more than just pain and chaos. If you listen to the inner guidance, you'll receive hints of an awakening or spiritual awakening. You can see the cracks forming and proactively act before the entire tower collapses, creating a more controlled 'great transformation.' This is your chance to break free from outdated ways of thinking that are holding you back. You'll become stronger, wiser, and more resilient with a new perspective on life.
reMeaning: The reversed Tower often indicates a significant process of self-transformation, occurring from within. Unlike the upright meaning, due to external circumstances, you are proactively questioning your belief system, values, and purpose in life. This could be a spiritual awakening. This is when you discover a new perspective and change your viewpoint on the core things in life. You are becoming a new version of yourself.

Sometimes, The Tower reversed is a sign that you are resisting change and delaying necessary 'reprogramming.' You may be denying the reality of what's happening or clinging to an outdated belief system even though you know it's no longer good. The card warns that if you continue to resist this development and transformation, 'strong measures' will be taken, as the change it brings is inevitable.

Finally, The Tower reversed may suggest that you are mitigating the impact of an impending change, especially if you are in tune with your intuition. You may have been warned or have a premonition that something big is coming, allowing you to plan ahead to avoid or at least minimize the level of destruction. You proactively plan and face it in a more 'pleasant' way.

18.name: The Star
18.reKeywords: Loss of faith; Despair; Self-confidence; Disconnection
description: Upon examining the card, we see the image of a naked woman kneeling by a lake. She holds two water jugs: one in her left hand (representing the subconscious) and one in her right hand (representing the conscious mind). She pours water to nourish the fertile land, symbolized by the lush green plants growing around her. The other jug ​​pours water onto dry land, the water flowing in five directions, representing the five senses.

The woman places one foot on the ground, representing her practical abilities, and the other in the water, representing her intuition and inner resources. She is always listening to her inner voice. She is naked, signifying her purity under the starry night sky. Behind her, a large shining star represents her core essence, and seven smaller stars represent the chakras.
meaning: The Star card appears right after the destruction and chaos of The Tower, bringing comfort and optimism. You have bravely overcome challenges, discarding all false beliefs that have hindered you to realize your core nature. You know that, no matter what life throws at you, you are always connected to pure loving energy and are helped by the Universe. This is a moment when you have a new sense of yourself, a new appreciation for the nature of life, signaling a period of deep healing and mental stability.

The Star ignites new hope and faith within you. Your heart is filled with hope, and you realize that your dreams can truly come true. The card says: 'Allow yourself to dream, to aspire, to elevate yourself in any way possible so that you can reach the stars.' This is a time for you to thrive, ready to receive positive things from the Universe.

With healing energy, you also want to rediscover inspiration in your life. You are making significant changes, becoming the newest version of yourself and choosing the best version of yourself. This is a profound spiritual journey. To do that, eliminate any false beliefs, concealment, or deception, and live with your true nature. The Star is also the card of a generous spirit; you have an open heart, and you want to share what you have received with others to help them change their lives.
reMeaning: The reversed Star card signals that you are losing faith and hope in the Universe. You may be feeling overwhelmed by life's challenges and questioning why you have to go through this right now. This is often a test of faith: will you crumble like The Tower or remain steadfast and believe that spiritual teachers are everywhere? Take some time to ask yourself, what is the lesson here, and why is this a good thing, not a punishment? You will learn to trust not only the Universe but also yourself to have spiritual teachers guide you.

The reversed Star also indicates that you have lost inspiration and are gradually becoming detached from your work, hobbies, relationships, or personal projects. You used to be very enthusiastic, but now you feel bored with the daily routine. You may no longer feel connected to your current work. To recover, reconnect with what truly matters and your purpose in life. Adjust your daily life to align with these things, and then you will find new sources of inspiration.

The reversed Star card encourages you to take time for self-care. Your energy reserves may be completely depleted, so instead of pushing yourself too hard, take time for yourself. Strengthen your spirit and reconnect with your inner self. You could get a massage, relax, go on a picnic, or simply meditate and reflect on yourself.

19.name: The Moon
description: Stepping into the card reveals a full moon in the night sky, nestled between two large towers. The Moon symbolizes intuition, dreams, and the subconscious. Its light is fainter than that of the Sun. It only illuminates the winding path to higher consciousness between the two towers with its weak light.

In front is a small pond, representing the subconscious. A small lobster crawls out of the pond, symbolizing the initial stages of consciousness beginning to unfold. A dog and a wolf stand in a meadow, howling at the moon, representing both the domesticated and wild aspects of our minds.
meaning: The Moon represents your fears and illusions. It appears when you are afraid of things happening in the present and future, based on painful experiences from the past. You may have had an unpleasant memory, but instead of confronting it, you suppressed it deep in your subconscious. Now, these emotions are resurfacing, affecting you at a conscious or unconscious level. A typical example is the fear from a childhood car accident causing you to feel anxious every time you sit in the back seat. To overcome this, you need to connect with your subconscious and release any fears or anxieties that are hindering you. You may need to see a mental health professional for support in this process.

The Moon signifies a period of chaos and ambiguity – things are not as they appear. Be cautious when making impulsive decisions, as you may later realize you lack sufficient information. Listen to and trust your intuition to see beyond what is currently apparent. Feel the situations instead of trying to understand their meaning. Let go of negative thoughts and allow your intuition to guide you. Dreams, intuition, and inner guidance will lead you forward if you listen and use reason to interpret the messages of your subconscious.

When The Moon card appears, pay attention to the lunar cycle. Connect with the divine feminine and explore deep intuitive insights and visions of what lies beyond everyday life. Set goals and sow opportunities on the new moon. And on the full moon, reflect on your accomplishments and consider what you need to release so that new aspects of yourself can shine.
reMeaning: The reversed Moon indicates that you have been confronted with illusions, fears, and anxieties, and now the negative influences from these energies are diminishing. You are in the process of overcoming your fears, understanding their impact on your life, and finding a way to break free from false beliefs. This is a genuine experience of letting go and transformation, marking the return of clarity.

However, on the other hand, The Moon reversed can suggest that you are trying to bury deeper emotions in your subconscious to avoid confronting your 'dark side.' You're not ready to face these feelings; you push them aside and pretend nothing is wrong. This only works in the short term, but ultimately, you'll need to dig these emotions up and deal with them forcefully to achieve true healing.

The reversed Moon can also indicate that you are receiving messages from your intuition but are having difficulty understanding their meaning. The message may be confusing, or your interpretation may seem different. The card urges you to listen to your inner voice, not the voice of others. Trust that the answers you need are already within you. Pay attention to your dreams and keep a dream journal, as this is how many subconscious messages are communicated. If you still find it difficult to understand, keep recording and reflect on it later when you have clearer clues.

20.name: The Sun
description: Stepping into the card, we see a source of optimistic and positive light. A large sun, shining in the sky, represents the origin of all life on Earth. Below, four sunflowers soar high on a brick wall, representing the four minor arcana and the four elements. In the foreground, a carefree child sits atop a gentle white horse. The child represents the joy of connecting with your inner spirit, and its nudity represents clarity—nothing to hide and all the purity and innocence of childhood. The white horse is also a symbol of purity and strength.
meaning: The Sun represents success, radiance, and abundance. This card is the strongest affirmation of joy, fulfillment, and ultimate happiness. Wherever you go or whatever you do, your positive and radiant energy will always follow you, bringing you happiness and joy. This is a time of brilliant victory and goal accomplishment. You are full of confidence because you know everything will be alright. Life is good!

People are drawn to you because you always see the good side of things and bring warmth into the lives of others. This beautiful, warm energy is what will help you get through difficult times and lead you to success. You are also in a position where you can share your highest qualities and achievements with others. Shine your best and what you represent, illuminating those you care about with your loving light. Like sunlight, this card brings absolute clarity to every situation.

The Sun connects you to the abundant inner energy that's radiating right now – not fear, not selfishness. You'll feel it in your solar plexus chakra, expressing yourself authentically and fully present in the world around you. This is a time to expect to experience an increase in physical energy, vitality, and positive personality. You're brimming with enthusiasm, energized, and enjoying a wonderful feeling of well-being. Tap into your energy and use your manifested will in truly positive ways.
reMeaning: The reversed Sun refers to your inherent carefree nature. When you see The reversed Sun in your Tarot reading, see it as a reminder to postpone your work and responsibilities, even if only for a moment, and just play. Dance like no one's watching, sing like no one's listening, and let your heart and soul soar, because you're lost in the hustle and bustle of life. This card suggests a temporary lack of joy or a clouded optimism. Enjoy everything like Taylor Swift in her 'Delicate' music video!

The reversed Sun may suggest that you are struggling to see the positive side of life and that clarity or truth has yet to be fully revealed. You may have experienced setbacks that have damaged your enthusiasm and optimism. However, The Sun is never a negative card, so this is only temporary. The obstacles you see can be easily overcome if you try, and you need to know that success is just waiting to arrive, not disappearing.

On the other hand, The Sun reversed can be a warning that you are being overly confident or overly optimistic. You may have become arrogant and out of touch with what you are capable of. Are you being honest with yourself and others? Or are you trying to flatter yourself even though you know you're not at that level? If this is true, seek advice from others and take a thorough look at yourself to avoid complacency overshadowing your true potential.

21.name: Judgement
21.reKeywords: Self-doubt; Inner criticism; Ignoring inner voice
description: Entering the card, naked men, women, and children rise from their graves, arms outstretched, and look up at the sky. Above, the angel Gabriel blows a trumpet. These people respond to his call, ready to be judged and to know whether they will be accepted into heaven. Behind them is a vast mountain range, symbolizing the impossibility of escaping judgment.
meaning: Judgement is a call to stand up and embrace a higher consciousness in order to serve your highest good. This is not merely a reflection, but a powerful upgrade of the soul. You are undergoing a profound spiritual awakening, realizing that you are suited to more than you thought. The angelic trumpet has sounded, and you have heard the call, ready to act to integrate with a higher frequency. Say goodbye to your past self and step into the newest, most optimal version of yourself.

This card often indicates that you are facing a life-changing decision at a crucial crossroads. Unlike logical decisions, this is a choice that requires a harmonious blend of intuition and intellect. You are acutely aware that any choice will bring about a significant change with lasting consequences. Align with your higher consciousness, trust your intuition, and believe that, with your self-observation, you are on the right path.

Judgement appears when you are nearing the completion of a crucial stage in your journey. You have finished reviewing and reassessing past experiences and challenges, and learned from them. Now, all the pieces of the final challenge are finally put together to form a unified picture of your life story. This convergence has also healed wounds, allowing you to leave the past behind. You have found forgiveness for yourself, erased any regrets, and freed yourself from any feelings of guilt or sadness. This purification process will leave you fresh and ready to face any new challenges.

The Judgement card also suggests that you should seek comfort and strength by sharing your difficulties with others. Remember that there are others who have gone through similar experiences and can guide you on the path to overcoming your troubles. Let them guide and help you move beyond the wounds of the past.
reMeaning: The reverse judgement requires a period of deep reflection and forced self-assessment. Perhaps you are hiding problems in your life because you fear being judged by others. Through meditation, seek deep understanding of what you need to change. To truly erase past mistakes and regrets, you must take powerful liberating action: forgive yourself, accept yourself, love yourself, and free yourself from the shackles of self-punishment.

This card appears when the Universe is trying to send you an important message, but you're not listening. You might be afraid of the challenges that come with this call, or worried that you're not ready for a bigger challenge, and want to stay in your comfort zone. You hope the challenges will disappear. But the truth is they will never disappear; on the contrary, they will only grow until you pay attention. This is the time to overcome your inner fears and self-doubt, believing that the Universe is always on your side.

The 'reverse judgment' often indicates that the echoes of self-criticism have become too apparent. You're doubting yourself or dwelling on negative thoughts, which prevents you from reaching your full potential and becoming the best version of yourself. To overcome this, view that negative voice as a distinct part of yourself: listen to it, acknowledge it, and then offer positive assurances that everything will be alright. When you act decisively, you can break the cycle of judgment and replace it with more constructive messages.

22.name: The World
description: Entering the card, a naked woman is wrapped in a purple cloth. She is dancing within a large wreath. She turns her head to look back at the past, but her body is facing the future. In her hands she holds two staffs, similar to those held by the magician in The Magician. The wreath symbolizes a continuous cycle: beginning, growth, and success. The woman has stepped through the wreath; she has completed one stage, but immediately she will move on to a new one.

Surrounding the laurel wreath are four mascots (lion, ox, angel, and eagle), similar to those in the Wheel of Fortune. Both The World and the Wheel of Fortune speak of the cyclical nature of life and progress through those cycles. The four mascots represent the four Fixed constellations – Leo, Taurus, Aquarius, and Scorpio. They symbolize the four elements, the four minor arcana in Tarot, the four compass directions, the four seasons, and the four corners of the Universe. They are here to guide you from one phase to the next, bringing balance and harmony to your journey.
meaning: The upright World card is the best sign of goal completion. After a long-term project, a prolonged learning or career cycle, you are enjoying a feeling of complete success. It signals major achievements such as graduation, marriage, or the fulfillment of a long-held dream or aspiration. Everything is happening at the same time; you have completed everything and are reaping the rewards you deserve.

This success comes with profound wisdom. The card encourages you to reflect on the journey so far, rejoice in what you have achieved, and consider the lessons learned. Every difficulty has tempered you, making you stronger, wiser, and more experienced. Celebrate your success and express gratitude before embarking on your next project.

Even though you're close to achieving your goal, The World reminds you that sometimes you still need to perfect the final details. Look back at your experiences and progress to strengthen yourself. If you still have unfinished business, you need to complete it to pave the way for new opportunities and beginnings ahead.
